Hi again,

this is weird... It seems the problem has got something to do with closing the 
team-sync perspective.

1) (with team synchronize window closed) I select the project and do a Team-
>Sync
2) Eclipse tries to sync with the remote repository but gets stuck. Eventually 
I get a broken pipe (or connection reset by peer) error.
3) I close the team sync perspective.

If I go 1->2->3 again I get the same error, *BUT* if I don't close the team 
sync perspective after the broken pipe and try to resync again (either by 
pressing F5 in the team perspective window or by doing team->sync) it works! (I 
don't get the error!)

I know it's not a fix... but maybe it can help other people ;)

Thanks 
Paolo



I don't know if this is the cause or not, but when searching for a solution to
this problem (which I had recently and persistently), I found this bug in
another list.  Hope this helps.

http://mail-index.netbsd.org/netbsd-bugs/2004/01/26/0011.html
Synopsis:       broken pipe race condition in CVS pserver
Description:
	There is a race condition in the CVS pserver code that
	causes CVS ops to abort with the "broken pipe" error message.
	What happens is the parent CVS process tries to tell the
	child to stop by writing a "S" to its flow control pipe.
	However, the child may already be dead and its read pipe
	is therefore closed.  This happens when there is enough
	outstanding data in the kernel socket buffers not yet read
	by the parent process when the child exits.  The master
	reads this data in and tries to send a message on its
	flowcontrol pipe to stop, but its flowcontrol pipe is
	already closed and the kernel sends a SIGPIPE to the parent
	PID.
